entities: United Nations Verification Mission in Colombia
summary:
The Security Council:

Reaffirms its commitment to the peace process in Colombia, recalling all relevant resolutions and statements. 

Welcomes progress made towards peace, urging parties to continue building on this progress, addressing ongoing challenges, particularly violence in conflict-affected areas, through comprehensive implementation of the Final Agreement.

Takes note of the Peacebuilding Commission's engagement with Colombia's Government, looking forward to further cooperation.

Recalls resolution 2366 (2017) establishing the UN Verification Mission in Colombia to verify implementation of the Final Agreement by Colombia's Government and FARC-EP.

Recalls resolutions 2574 (2021), 2673 (2023), and 2694 (2023) expanding the Verification Mission's mandate to verify compliance with sentences, monitor rural reform, the Ethnic Chapter, and ceasefire implementation.

Decides to extend the Verification Mission's mandate until 31 October 2024.

Expresses willingness to work with Colombia's Government on further extending the mandate based on an agreement between parties.
